output: Kitty's letters to her family are consistently brief despite being eagerly anticipated.

instruction: Highlight the central theme of the paragraph in one sentence:
input: the thought will doubtless seem heretical to more than one school of critics, that construction is not the highest merit, the choicest gift, of the novelist. It sets off his other gifts and graces most advantageously to the critical eye; and the want of it will sometimes mar those graces--appreciably, though not quite consciously--to eyes by no means ultra-critical. But a very badly-built novel which excelled in pathetic or humorous character, or which displayed consummate command of dialogue--perhaps the rarest of all faculties--would be an infinitely better thing than a faultless plot acted and told by puppets with pebbles in
output: The quality of construction can enhance or detract from a novelist's other talents.
